title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #471 (Ulam's Problem):**

Given a finite set of primes Q₀, define Qᵢ₊₁ = Qᵢ ∪ {primes that are sums of 3 distinct elements of Qᵢ}.

**Question:** Is there Q₀ such that |Qᵢ| → ∞?

**Answer:** YES

By Vinogradov's theorem, taking Q₀ = {primes ≤ N} for large N ensures all primes eventually appear.

**Status:** SOLVED

title: IsSumOfThreeDistinctPrimes
content:
**Sum of three distinct primes:**

n is a sum of three distinct primes from S if:
∃ p, q, r ∈ S with p ≠ q ≠ r and n = p + q + r

All three must be prime and distinct.

title: nextQ
QSeq
content:
**The sequence Qᵢ:**

- Q₀ = initial set
- Qᵢ₊₁ = nextQ(Qᵢ)

Iteratively apply the closure operation.

title: QLim
content:
**The limit Q∞:**

Q∞ = ⋃ᵢ Qᵢ

The set of all primes that eventually appear in the sequence.

title: UlamsQuestion
content:
**Ulam's Question:**

Does there exist a finite set of primes Q₀ such that |Qᵢ| → ∞?

Equivalently: can we start with finitely many primes and generate arbitrarily many through three-element sums?

title: Vinogradov's Theorem
content:
**Vinogradov's Three Primes Theorem (1937):**

Every sufficiently large odd integer is the sum of three primes.

There exists N such that: n > N and n odd ⟹ n = p + q + r for primes p, q, r.

title: Vinogradov for Smaller Primes
content:
**Key variant:**

For large primes p > N, there exist smaller primes q₁, q₂, q₃ < p such that p = q₁ + q₂ + q₃.

This is the crucial ingredient: large primes decompose into smaller ones!

title: vinogradovQ₀
content:
**The Solution:**

Take Q₀ = {primes ≤ N} where N is Vinogradov's constant.

This finite set generates all primes: any prime > N is a sum of three smaller primes, which are either in Q₀ or added later.

title: ulams_question_positive
content:
**Answer: YES**

Ulam's question has a positive answer.

With Q₀ = {primes ≤ N}, the sequence Qᵢ grows without bound, eventually containing all primes.

title: stronger_question_positive
content:
**Stronger Result:**

Not only does |Qᵢ| → ∞, but Q∞ = {all primes}.

Every prime eventually appears in the sequence.

title: ulamQ₀
QSeq_monotone
content:
**Monotonicity:**

Qᵢ ⊆ Qᵢ₊₁ for all i.

Once a prime enters the sequence, it stays forever.

title: QSeq_primes
content:
**Primes Only:**

If Q₀ contains only primes, then Qᵢ contains only primes for all i.

The closure operation preserves primality.

title: erdos_471_summary
content:
**Complete Summary:**

Erdős Problem #471 is **SOLVED**.

**QUESTION:** Is there Q₀ such that |Qᵢ| → ∞?

**ANSWER:** YES

**KEY INSIGHT:** Vinogradov's theorem ensures large primes decompose into smaller ones.

**CONTRIBUTORS:** Ulam (question), Mrazović-Kovač, Alon (resolution)
